title: Volunteer Legal Advocate Interview
Interview Descriptions:
The skype interview was roughly 45 minutes long. Average to difficult. Some of the questions were the usual ones, others were based on case scenarios so the difficulty ultimately depends on previous 
relevant field experience. All panel members were very professional. I heard back around 20 days after the interview was conducted. What I did not like was that the e-mail I got was in its entirety copied-pasted from the internet, up to the "very trully yours" at the end, which is not very respectful and makes the feedback given meaningless.
Interview Questions: How does you experience relate to this role?

title: Communications and Development Interview
Application Type: I applied through an employee referral. The process took 2 weeks. I interviewed at Asylum Access (Quito) in Feb 2016
Interview Descriptions: I applied online by sending a cover email answering the job specification from the website and describing my previous experience, then had an in person interview with my two supervisors. They asked questions about ny previous experience and what I could bring to the role. They responded in around 2 weeks. The interview atmosphere was friendly and relaxed.
Interview Questions:
What experience do you have in this field?

What do you know about the organization?

What aspects of the work interest you most?

What can you bring to the role?

What is your visa status?

How many hours can you commit to?

How do you feel about remote working?

When can you start?
